categories.title: Prophets
categories.description: The noble messengers of Allah who guided humanity

categories.title: Companions
categories.description: The blessed companions (Sahaba) of Prophet Muhammad ﷺ

categories.title: Scholars
categories.description: The great Islamic scholars who preserved and explained the religion

prophets.name: Adam
prophets.title: First Prophet of Allah
prophets.description: The first human being and prophet, created directly by Allah. Father of humanity.
prophets.significance: First prophet to receive divine revelation and teach monotheism to humanity.

prophets.name: Noah
prophets.title: Prophet of the Flood
prophets.description: Built the Ark under divine command to save believers and animals from the great flood.
prophets.significance: Demonstrated unwavering faith through centuries of persecution.

prophets.name: Abraham
prophets.title: Friend of Allah (Khalilullah)
prophets.description: The patriarch of monotheistic religions, known for his absolute submission to Allah.
prophets.significance: Built the Kaaba and established the rituals of Hajj.

prophets.name: Moses
prophets.title: Speaker with Allah (Kalimullah)
prophets.description: Led the Israelites out of Egypt and received the Torah on Mount Sinai.
prophets.significance: Received divine scripture and led his people to freedom.

prophets.name: Jesus
prophets.title: Spirit of Allah (Ruhullah)
prophets.description: Born miraculously to Virgin Mary, performed miracles by Allah's permission.
prophets.significance: Taught pure monotheism and was raised to heaven.

prophets.name: Muhammad
prophets.title: The Final Prophet ﷺ
prophets.description: The final messenger of Allah, who received and transmitted the Holy Quran.
prophets.significance: Completed and perfected the message of Islam for all humanity.

companions.name: Abu Bakr
companions.title: As-Siddiq (The Truthful)
companions.description: First caliph of Islam and closest companion of Prophet Muhammad ﷺ.
companions.significance: First adult male to accept Islam and crucial supporter during early Islam.

companions.name: Umar ibn Al-Khattab
companions.title: Al-Farooq (The Criterion)
companions.description: Second caliph of Islam, known for his justice and strength.
companions.significance: Expanded Islamic territory and established administrative systems.

companions.name: Uthman ibn Affan
companions.title: Dhun-Nurayn (Possessor of Two Lights)
companions.description: Third caliph of Islam, known for his modesty and generosity.
companions.significance: Compiled the standardized version of the Quran.

companions.name: Ali ibn Abi Talib
companions.title: Asadullah (Lion of Allah)
companions.description: Fourth caliph of Islam, cousin and son-in-law of Prophet Muhammad ﷺ.
companions.significance: Known for his knowledge, bravery, and justice.

scholars.name: Abu Hanifa
scholars.title: Al-Imam Al-A'zam (The Great Imam)
scholars.description: Founder of the Hanafi school of Islamic jurisprudence.
scholars.significance: Developed systematic legal reasoning in Islamic law.

scholars.name: Malik ibn Anas
scholars.title: Imam Dar al-Hijrah
scholars.description: Founder of the Maliki school of Islamic jurisprudence.
scholars.significance: Compiled Al-Muwatta, one of the earliest hadith collections.

scholars.name: Al-Shafi'i
scholars.title: Nasir al-Hadith (Defender of Hadith)
scholars.description: Founder of the Shafi'i school of Islamic jurisprudence.
scholars.significance: Developed the science of Islamic legal theory (Usul al-Fiqh).

scholars.name: Ahmad ibn Hanbal
scholars.title: Imam Ahl al-Sunnah
scholars.description: Founder of the Hanbali school of Islamic jurisprudence.
scholars.significance: Compiled the Musnad Ahmad, a major hadith collection.
